fact: A Bible published in England in 1632 missed out the word 'not' in the seventh Commandment, making it 'Thou shalt commit adultery'. It became known as 'The Wicked Bible'.
According to the Bible, there are 12 pearly gates.
All Hebrew orignating names that end with the letters "el" have something to do with God.
Almonds and pistachios are the only nuts mentioned in the Bible.
Beelzebub, another name for the devil, is Hebrew for Lord of the Flies, and this is where the books title comes from.
Bethany is the traditional site of the ascension.
Both Esther and Song of Solomon do not mention the word God.
Cain was the first baby born in the bible.
Christianity has a billion followers. Islam is next in representation with half this number.
Delilah had to cut seven tresses of hair from Samson's head to render him powerless.
Dismas and Gestas were the names of the two thieves crucified with Jesus.
Enoch and Elijah are the 2 men in the bible that don't die.
In a century's time, Islam had converted 1/3 of the world.
In addition to the animals there were eight people on Noah's Ark. Noah, his wife, his sons Shem, Ham and Japheth, and their wives.
Jesus is believed to have spoken in Aramaic, the language then in use in the Arabian peninsular where he lived. A modern version of the language is still spoken in Syria.
Jesus was baptized in the River Jordan by John The Baptist.
Jesus was described as 'King of Jews' as a deliberate insult to the Jewish authorities on the part of Pilate, the governor of Judea.
John Wycliffe wrote the first English translation of the bible. (Middle English 1380's)
King James I produced his authorized version of the bible in 1611.
Methuselah lived to be 969 years old, according to Genesis.
Portions of the Bible have been printed in 2,212 languages. A complete Bible exists in 366 languages; an additional 928 languages have a New Testament; and 918 have at least one book of the Bible.
Salome's dance was the only solo dance mentioned in the Bible.
Saul was the first king of the Jews.
Scholars estimate that the 66 books of the King James version of the Bible were written by some 50 different authors.
Seven suicides are mentioned in the Bible.

Some biblical scholars believe that Aramaic did not contain a way of saying 'many' and used a term that has come down to us as '40'. This means that when the Bible refers to 40 days it actually means 'many days'.
St.Paul was the main writer of the epistles.
The 27 books of the Bible's New Testament are believed to have been written circa AD 100, about 70 to 90 years after the death of Christ.

The Bible consists of a collection of 66 seperate books. These books were chosen, after a bit of haggling, by the Catholic Council of Carthage in 397 AD - more than 350 years after the time of Jesus. This collection is broken into two major sections: The Old Testament, which consists of 39 books, and the New Testament, which consists of 27 books. (Catholic Bibles include an additional 12 books known as the Apocrypha)
The Bible devotes some 500 verses on prayer, less than 500 verses on faith but over 2,000 verses on money and possessions.
The Bible does not say there were three wise men, or magi; it only says there were three gifts. It is believed there were anywhere between 2 and 9 magi.
The Bible does not say there were three wise men; it only says there were three gifts.
The Bible has been translated into over 2,000 languages
The Bible is actually a library of 66 books, written by 44 authors over a period of about 1500 years
The Bible is the number one shoplifted book in America.
The Bible was the first book to be printed, in 1454
The Bible, the world's best-selling book, is also the world's most shoplifted book.
The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse, named in the Bible's Book of Revelation, are Conquest, Slaughter, Famine and Death.
The Greek version of the Old Testament is called the Septuagent.
The Lord's Prayer appears twice in the Bible - in Matthew VI and Luke XI.
The New Testament was originally written in Greek
The Old Testament is almost identical to the Jewish Tanakh
The Old Testament was originally written in Hebrew

The Pekingese dog was considered sacred among Chinese Royalty. At the court of Li Hsui, one of the last Manchu queens, all court Pekingese had human wet nurses. Each dog had its own eunuch to protect it from other dogs; some even had private palaces, complete with servants.
The Red Sea is not mentioned in the Bible.
The book of Esther is the only book of the Bible that never mentions God
The book of Kells were found in 8th century in Ireland.
The cost of raising a medium-size dog to the age of eleven is $6,400.
The crucifixion of Jesus took place on Calvary Hill (known as Golgotha in Hebrew).
The first Bible to be published in America was in the language of the Algonquian Indians.
The first English translation of the new testament was by William Tynedale. (1526 Early modern English)
The first complete version of the bible actually printed in English was the Coverdale Bible in 1535 compiled by Myles Coverdale.
The first drunk to appear in the bible was Noah.
The longest book in the bible is the Book of Psalms.
The longest name in the Bible is Mahershalalbaz.
The longest verse in the Bible is Esther 8:9
The most common name in the Bible is Zechariah. There are 33 of them.
The most mentioned woman in the bible is Sarah at 56 times
The names of the two theives crucified with Jesus were Dismas and Gestas.
The only woman whose age is mentioned in the Bible is Sarah, who bore Abraham a child, Isaac, when she was 90. She was said to die at the age of 127.
The savage Salem witch trials in the seventeenth century were all based on a sinlge line in the Exodus: 'Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live'.
The shortest book in the Bible is 2 John.
The shortest verse in the Bible is John 11:35
The three wise men were called Balthazar, Caspar and Melchior.
The world population at the time of the Crucifixion was about 200 million.
The writers of the New Testament used a Greek translation of the OT known as the Septuagint
There are 150 Psalms in the bible.
There are 39 books in the old testament and 27 in the new testament.
There were 3 decks on Noah's Ark.
Two chapters in the Bible, 2 Kings and Isaiah 37, are alike almost word for word.
War, Famine, Pestilence and Death were the four horseman of the apocalypse.
